text: RT @RepSusieLee My fellow new Members & I were elected to work. But @SenateMajLdr McConnell seems to think otherwise. After 27 days, he still hasn’t allowed a single vote in the Senate on multiple House plans to re-open government. RT if you think he’s wrong! #EndTheShutdown #WheresMitch

So why is he keeping the government shut down and leaving 42,000 service members without paychecks for the first time in history?

Paradise can't afford any delay when it comes to recovery efforts. Survivors there don’t deserve any more uncertainty and anxiety. 
https://twitter.com/NPR/status/1085895011500081152 QT @NPR In Paradise, Calif. –– a town almost completely destroyed by a deadly wildfire last Nov. –– the shutdown is causing delays in infrastructure projects, threatening to leave the town "in a worse position than we were before the fire," a local official says.
https://www.npr.org/2019/01/17/685880550/shutdown-threatens-to-stall-recovery-in-wildfire-ravaged-paradise-calif?utm_source=twitter.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=npr&utm_term=nprnews&utm_content=20190117

We are taking a historic step to provide more than one million New Jersey workers a stronger foothold in the middle class.

At a time of massive income and wealth inequality, Trump’s policies are moving this country in exactly the wrong direction. Over 83% of the benefits of Trump’s tax plan is going to the top 1%. https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/jan/16/trump-economy-billionaires-working-people
Proud to stand with hard working @seiu521 Fresno Superior Court employees as they ask for a fair contract that values the dignity of their work and contribution to the community.

The last time the federal minimum wage was increased was 2009. It’s been almost ten years since working Americans were given the raise they deserve. I joined my colleagues this week to re-introduce the Raise the Wage Act, which would raise the minimum wage to $15 by 2024.
